newsitem.title: USA: Hadco stock tumbles; posts loss and plans to add more shares.
newsitem.headline: Hadco stock tumbles; posts loss and plans to add more shares.

text.p: The stock of Hadco Corp. lost nearly 12 percent of its value Wednesday, one day after the maker of printed computer circuits reported a large loss in the latest quarter, and announced plans to offer 2 million additional shares.
Hadco was off $7 at $47.50 on the Nasdaq market.

The company said it lost $69.1 million, or $6.64, a share in its fiscal first quarter ended Jan. 25, compared with profits of $7.2 million, or 65 cents a share, a year earlier. Revenues jumped to $111.5 million from $76.4 million.
Hadco said the loss stemmed from a $78 million write-off to acquire Zycon Corp.
The company also said it intends to register with the Securities and Exchange Commission an offering of up to 2 million shares of common stock and $100 million of convertible subordinated notes.
The company said it plans to use some of the proceeds from the offerings to repay part of its outstanding bank debt and the rest for general corporate purposes, which may include acquisitions.
